titleStmt.title: Alexander Ostrander to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1931

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
ALEX. OSTRANDER,
Attorney & Counsellor at Law,
NOTARY PUBLIC,
AND COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS FOR NEW-YORK CITY,
And duly authorised to take Depositions, Acknowledgments of Deeds, Powers of Attorney, &c. for
New-York,
New-Jersey,
Pennsylvania,
Virginia,
Massachusetts,
Connecticut,
Rhode Island,
New-Hampshire,
Vermont,
Maine,
Tennessee,
Kentucky,
North Carolina,
Oregon,
Ohio
Illinois,
Iowa,
Indiana,
Michigan,
Wisconsin,
Minnesota,
Missouri,
Texas,
District Columbia,
Kansas,
California, and the other States and Territories.
OFFICE, No. 239 BROADWAY,
Rooms 12 &13, (Entrance No. 1 Park Place.)
Residence, No.
FEES.
Acknowledgments of not more than two persons, for other States, at the Office $1 00
do do do for use on record in this State, 38
do do do at the City Residence of party, an additional charge is made, usually 1 00
PASSPORTS obtained for
2 00
Acknowledgments taken at private Residences in any part of the City.

New York, Aug. 2d 1864
Hon. Thos. E. Bramlette
Gov. of Kentucky.
Dear Sir,
I respectfully ask at your hands an appointment as Commissioner of Deeds for your State, to reside in this City.
The necessary fees will be forwarded when known, also such references given as may be required.

New York
Comr Deeds
Alex Ostrander
Appt
18th Aug/64
